entry.title: Bitcoin TX fill-or-kill deterministic behavior
entry.summary: In a forum discussion, Jeff Garzik raised concerns about the wallet client's direct payer-payer communication with merchants and suggested a separate protocol for such transactions. However, it was noted that Satoshi Nakamoto initially saw pay-to-IP-address as the primary payment method, with pay-to-address as a backup when the recipient was offline. The original Bitcoin design involved direct communication between participants, but things have evolved differently. Jeff Garzik believes that using a separate protocol on a separate port, possibly an HTTP derivative, would make life easier for mobile payments, firewalled scenarios, and client-merchant communications. Pieter also asked if anyone had read https://gist.github.com/1237788.
